intro: Costus clemensiae, commonly known as the dwarf costus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers with a slight fragrance. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Costus clemensiae prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
